text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen I am in 
Bangkok Thailand and I happen to be here in June

which doesn't usually happen - it's really 
hot and soon so I try to avoid it but being

here in June is great for one thing and that is 
durian yes it is durian season so I thought what

an opportune moment to make a dessert that is my 
absolute favorite durian dish and that is durian

and sticky rice or cameo kao niew turien kao niew is sticky 
rice and turien is durian it also happens to be

my guest favorites dessert and it's his birthday 
yesterday so yeah it'll be his birthday thing it

is so easy it's one of the easiest dessert ever 
and if you can't get fresh durian you can also

use frozen durian in this dessert it won't break 
the dish and if your durian lover definitely try

it if you're not a durian lover try it anyway 
you might change your mind all right let's get

started so the durian we don't we're not going to 
do anything to it but the most important thing is

you want to make sure it's ripe because we 
want this to be soft and creamy and if it's

under rightly to be kind of crunchy and almost 
a bit starchy not good okay I'm using mom's Hong

which is the name of a variety that's mostly 
widely available not too expensive and quite a

mild flavor you can use other varieties that have 
a more pungent flavor as well if you want is kind

of up to you now the sticky rice is exactly the 
same as a sticky rice use for mango and sticky

rice so if you already know how to make that 
then this part is a breeze okay so I'll just

quickly go through how the secure ice is made 
I've got some Thai sticky rice steaming away

in my traditional bamboo steamer if you want to 
know more about sticky rice I have a few videos

actually about sticky rice make sure I'll put 
the link in the description below and also right

up here now I'm going to make the coconut syrup 
that we're going to pour over the rice just some

coconut milk and I'm just going to sweeten it 
with some sugar but I'm actually reducing the

amount of coconut milk sorry ID amount of sure 
a little bit from my mango sticky rice version

because the durian is already quite sweet a 
little bit of salt to cut the sweetness and

just going to put this on the sole to let the 
sugar and the salt will dissolve and that's

that okay so good sticky rice it's ready to go 
so it's going to plop it right into whoo we have

some pandan leaves at home so I just kind of put 
them in just for extra flavor you don't have to

hand and leave like the Thai vanilla Oh hot just 
going to quickly pour my syrup over this rice hot

everything is not hot yeah and now I'm going to 
cut it quickly work and it looks really soupy do

not worry it will absorb all of that liquid and 
become luscious and juicy and that is it so we'll

let this sit it will take in my sphere is about 
40 minutes easy VARs number one is finished now

is easy bar number two we're basically making 
a durian soup that we're going to pour over as

a sticky rice and the broth is so simple I've 
got here just some coconut milk and I'm going

to sweeten it with palm sugar and this is the 
crucial part is you have to use palm sugar if

you substitute white sugar or any other kind 
you're going to miss that flavor from the palm

sugar that is absolutely key in this dish so this 
is the one thing I will say don't substitute okay

and I'm actually using this pasty palm sugar here 
that I can actually find in Canada so I'm excited

to use it although I kind of have to play with 
it as I go because I'm not used to you know the

proportions of how much of this I would need this 
is the same palm sugar as the ones that you see me

use in blocks except they don't reduce it down 
as far so it's more liquid and it is easier to

use here it comes in a bag like this right and so 
you just take a spoon and spoon it out it's like

this thick paste that's really really delicious 
oh so good and now I'm going to add a little salt

ways to cut the sweetness and would you believe 
that that is all there is to it apart from you

know adding the durian but now I'm just going 
to put this on the stove let the sugar melt and

then I'm going to taste it and again since we're 
working with fresh fruit you want to make sure you

work with the natural sweetness of the fruit if 
the fruit is very sweet this may not need to be

that sweet if the search is last week maybe you 
didn't get a really ripe one maybe you want to

make this a little sweet so the syrup is done and 
I did end up having to taste and add a little more

sugar but you want it to be be quite sweet but not 
too sweet because this is going to be like poured

all over your sticky rice which is already sweet 
right so now while this is still hot I want to

get my durian even there because then the durian 
will have a chance to sort of infuse the flavor

into the syrup and so I just make chunks like this 
see so good I just make little chunks like this so

it's a little bigger than bite size you don't want 
to make it too small because otherwise it just

looks like a little random bits of weird stuff in 
there some people at this point they like to cook

the durian in the syrup and you can do that if 
your if you want the durian to really integrate

with the syrup but I find that that just risks 
overcooking the during a little bit so you can do

that definitely if your durian is not too mushy 
and you can pack as much durian in here as you

like since you're making it yourself see when you 
buy dirt and sticky rice I find they never give

you enough during because that's the expensive 
part right so when you make it yourself you're

like yeah I'm going to like pack this thing now 
I'm going to let that just sort of sit and infuse

a little bit while that's happening let's take 
a look at the sticky rice hmm and how it's doing

whew most of the syrups already been absorbed just 
going to give it one quick flip just because you

notice the bottom has some liquid pooling and I 
just find giving it a big fold halfway through it

just makes it more evenly distributed okay that 
has 20 more minutes to go about 20 more minutes

to go and then they'll both finish perfectly 
at the same time my sticky rice is ready to go

it's still warm my broth Derian broth is ready 
to go time to put it all together and not too

much because you know it's like a pretty heavy 
dish right so you just usually people just have

that much sticky rice and then the durian has 
sort of like softened a little bit in the heat

it's infused the flavor into the coconut broth oh 
yeah that's like way more durian than any vendor

would give you then you kind of break apart the 
sticky rice so that it mixes with the syrup Oh

especially when it's warm it's still good the 
durian just kind of dissolves on your tongue

because it's hot and warm it's creamy and then you 
get to chew on the sticky rice all the flavor work

together really well and the durian flavor isn't 
that pungent it is something have include ones

it's mixed with the coconut milk and once it's 
heated a little bit and the durian is that the

perfect ripeness it's just so so good this is a 
must try of your during lover if you're not during

lover again I think you should try it and maybe 
it'll change your mind I hope you give this a try

to recipe as always would be unhappy I've kissing
